properties.areaDesc: Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island
properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 17 at 11:46AM AST until February 17 at 4:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS OCCURRING ACROSS THE
SOUTHWESTERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO...

The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag
Warning, which is in effect until 4 PM AST this afternoon.

* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 027.

* WIND...15 to 20 mph with gusts to around 30 mph.

* HUMIDITY...40-50 percent.

* THUNDERSTORMS...None.

* HIGHEST THREAT...is located across the southwest coast of
Puerto Rico, in the vicinity of Cabo Rojo.

* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE SOUTHWEST COASTAL PLAINS
